channel.title: [317]Client help
channel.description: Ok well i put the model in my clients models folder and ingame when i type add model MODELNUMBER, it doesn't say anything. im using delta based so it does have it coded, just not my servers client ;s

item.title: [317]Client help
item.dc:creator: @Barrage1 Denoria
item.description:
@Barrage1 wrote:

[quote=“adamhelloman8, post:3, topic:273713”]Well - that command is client side.

Try searching you’re client class in you’re client for ‘add model’

If you can’t find anything, try adding this.

[code]if(s.startsWith(“add model”))
{
try
{
int ModelIndex = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(10));
byte[] abyte0 = GetModel(ModelIndex);
if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0){
aClass14Array970[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, ModelIndex);
method77(“Model: [”+ModelIndex+"] added successfully!", 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}else{
method77("Unable to find the model. "+ModelIndex, 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}
}
catch(Exception e)
{
method77("Syntax - ::add model ", 0, “”, aBoolean991);}
}

else[/code][/quote]thanks it was under add models but it still does this fucking pest control ball splatter emote…gfx

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Client help

item.description:
@adamhelloman8 wrote:

Well - that command is client side.

Try searching you’re client class in you’re client for ‘add model’

If you can’t find anything, try adding this.

[code]if(s.startsWith(“add model”))
{
try
{
int ModelIndex = Integer.parseInt(s.substring(10));
byte[] abyte0 = GetModel(ModelIndex);
if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0){
aClass14Array970[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, (byte)2, ModelIndex);
method77(“Model: [”+ModelIndex+"] added successfully!", 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}else{
method77("Unable to find the model. "+ModelIndex, 0, “”, aBoolean991);
}
}
catch(Exception e)

else[/code]
